author: robocopsgonemad
content: only because numbers are actually defined in the json spec, so not using strings for thems reduces ambiguity

author: jameshe5018
content: oops missed the response... but I think we chose to do string in other places for some reasons on how numbers are limited  ( might not apply in this case) but we definitely chose to use string for numbers in several places including all the beacon api specs

author: ajsutton
content: It's because JSON is based on JavaScript and JavaScript always uses doubles for numbers so has limited accuracy.  If you use a plain number for something like an account balance and parse the JSON with javascript you can wind up with an incorrect balance (and I don't think there's anything you can do about it, but not sure if that's changed in more recent versions now that they do have BigInt)
